    RX 580 Mining Review: Buy This Miner?

    RX 580 Mining Overall Scores:

    • Mining Performance: 4/5
    • Power Consumption: 3.5/5
    • Cooling: 5/5
    • Price/Performance: 4/5

    If you want to mine Ethereum, we suggest the Radeon R9 295X2. It’s the best Ethereum miner on the market!

    RX 580 Mining Overview

    The RX 580 was originally designed for gaming. Once miners got their hands on it back in the summer of 2017, the price skyrocketed. Since then it’s come back down, making it much more affordable for those looking to start mining.

    Unfortunately, the RX 580 consumes more power than its predecessor, the RX 480. It also has the same hashrate. While this is disappointing, miners have found a way to optimize this GPU for mining by tweaking the BIOS. If you overclock/underpower the GPU it becomes far more profitable for mining.

    This video guide explains how you can do this with your RX 580:

    RX 580 Hashrate: Ethereum

    Let’s take a look at the RX 580’s Ethereum mining performance.

    Stock Performance:

    • Hashrate: 24 MH/s
    • Power Consumption: 136 W

    Overclocked Performance:

    • 29 MH/s
    • Power Consumption: 153 W

    Here are your projected earnings after overclocking:

    As you can see, the RX 580 seems pretty promising when modifications are made in the BIOS. While it’s not the best Ethereum miner, it’ll deliver pretty good performance for its price of just $350.

    You can check your own Ethereum mining profitability with this calculator.

    Ethereum Mining Conclusion

    Should you use the RX 580 for Ethereum mining?

    It’s a yes from me.

    Although it shows sub-par performance at stock speeds, it can really turn into a money making machine with some tweaks in the BIOS. You can expect over $1,000 annually per card.

    Alternative Ethereum Mining Hardware

    Radeon RX 480 $719.62 Compare Lowest Prices
    Radeon HD 7990 $869.12 Compare Lowest Prices

    RX 580 Hashrate: Zcash

    We’ve seen the RX 580’s’ Ethereum mining performance, but how does it fair mining Zcash? We’ll, let’s take a look:

    Stock Performance:

    • 399 Sol/s
    • Power Consumption: 140 W

    As for overclocked performance, we weren’t able to find any solid information. You can probably play around with your card in the BIOS and improve the mining performance a bit. As for now, we’re just going to focus on the stock speeds.

    Here’s the projected Zcash mining performance:

    If you tweak some settings in the BIOS you can probably expect even better mining performance. Remember, it’s all about the power/hash ratio!

    You can check your own Zcash mining profitability with this calculator.

    Alternative Zcash Mining Hardware

    PIC GPU Annual Return Buy

    Other Altcoins

    We looked around and found this card’s mining performance with other altcoins. Take a look:

    • Decred (DCR): 1.220 GHS
    • CryptoNight (XMR): 600 H/s
    • LBRY (LBC): 0.165 GHS
    • Pascal (PASC): 0.830 GHS
    • X11Ghost (SIB): 8.2 MHS

    Conclusion

    At first glance, the RX 580 seems to be a bad choice. Of course, you should never judge a book by its cover. After modifications in the BIOS, the GPU proves itself mining both Ethereum and Zcash. You can expect returns of over $1,000 per card! If you’re interested in purchasing a mining GPU, we would recommend the RX 580 as a good choice.
